title: [QUESTION] Can OpenGL ES be used as backend
body:
Hello,

I made a C native library to create a EGL context on a raspberry pi 4 and be able to draw in a VideoCore native window. The context is successfully created and can be used in that native lib.

I then made a C# lib to wrap the native one using p/invoke. The call is made, and the EGL context is created.

Is it possible to use it as a backend for SkiaSharp ?

I tried the following code : 

```CSharp 
IntPtr glContext = _bridge.CreateGLContext(); // My native call
var info = new SKImageInfo(1920, 1080);
var context = GRContext.Create(GRBackend.OpenGL); // null
var surface = SKSurface.Create(context, false, info); // Exception
```

And
```CSharp 
IntPtr glContext = _bridge.CreateGLContext();
var info = new SKImageInfo(1920, 1080);
var glInterface = GRGlInterface.CreateNativeGlInterface(); // maybe this ?
var context = GRContext.Create(GRBackend.OpenGL, glInterface); // nope, still null
var surface = SKSurface.Create(context, false, info);
```

It's of course, on the same thread.

I don't know what to do or is this even possible

Thanks for your help
